etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘guard life,’ it denotes practices and conditions that protect health. In modern usage it spans personal cleanliness and public sanitation.
etymology.simplification: 衛 was simplified to 卫 by adopting an ancient variant and reducing strokes for ease of writing; 生 is unchanged.

parts.english: life; to be born; grow; raw

examples.chinese: 请注意卫生(請注意衛生)，勤洗手(勤洗手)。
examples.english: Please pay attention to hygiene and wash your hands frequently.

examples.chinese: 公共场所要保持卫生(公共場所要保持衛生)。
学校定期进行卫生检查(學校定期進行衛生檢查)。
examples.english: The school conducts regular hygiene inspections.
